stem: The external iliac artery changes its name to the femoral artery at which landmark?

choices.A: As it passes deep to the inguinal ligament
choices.B: At the level of the patella
choices.C: As it exits the adductor hiatus

rationale_correct: External iliac becomes femoral as it passes beneath the inguinal ligament.

rationale_distractors.B: No arterial name change occurs at the patella.
rationale_distractors.C: Femoral becomes popliteal at the adductor hiatus.
rationale_distractors.D: Popliteal region is distal to the name change to popliteal, not femoral.
rationale_distractors.E: No relevant name change occurs at the ankle.

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout â€” Transition points. Jun 16, 2025.
